ai_agents.description: Autonomous AI agents that execute multi-step workflows for up to 20 minutes
capabilities: Search across Notion, Slack, Google Drive, Teams
Add to or edit databases autonomously
Read page version history to understand changes

implementation_approach.architecture: Central reasoning model that coordinates modular sub-agents
implementation_approach.model_routing: Break down tasks by category and route to best model (GPT-5, Claude Opus 4.1, o3) based on quality, latency, cost
implementation_approach.context_system: Block-based architecture where every paragraph, task, or database entry is a block with metadata and relationships
implementation_approach.integration: MCP (Model Context Protocol) for token-efficient, Markdown-based API

technical_details.context_awareness: Highlights on page automatically add as context
technical_details.multi_platform: Deep integration with Slack, Google Drive, Teams for cross-platform context

model_access.routing_strategy: Task-specific routing based on requirements for reasoning, ambiguity handling, research

research_mode.description: Generate detailed documents with research capabilities

meeting_notes.description: Dedicated block for meeting capture and synthesis

privacy.training: Does not train on workspace data

notion_ai_features.availability: Included exclusively in Business and Enterprise plans (mid-2025)
what_makes_it_compelling: Shift from 'AI that suggests' to 'AI that executes'
Multi-model approach uses best tool for each job
Deep cross-platform context from multiple services
Autonomous multi-step workflows reduce manual intervention
Block-based architecture provides rich structured context

karma_points.description: Point system earned by completing tasks and using features

earning: Complete tasks (more points for complex/priority tasks)
mechanics.progression: Accumulate points to advance through levels

implementation_approach.point_calculation: Variable points based on task priority, complexity, recurrence

streaks.description: Consecutive days of completing set number of tasks
streaks.purpose: Incentivize daily usage and consistent productivity

implementation_approach.calculation: Track consecutive days with at least N tasks completed
implementation_approach.ui_prominence: Visual indicator of current streak length

streaks.user_impact: Users 2.3x more likely to engage daily after 7+ day streak

levels.description: Progression system from Beginner to Enlightened

implementation_approach.thresholds: Define karma points required for each level
implementation_approach.unlock_features: Premium features or themes at higher levels
implementation_approach.social_sharing: Allow users to share level achievements

business_impact.productivity_increase: Users break down large projects into smaller tasks to earn points
business_impact.engagement: Karma system drives consistent app usage
business_impact.retention: 40-60% higher daily active users (DAU) for apps with streaks + milestones

implementation_lessons.progression_visibility: Clear levels provide sense of achievement

what_makes_it_compelling: Non-intrusive - enhances rather than distracts from productivity

mechanics.unlinked_mentions: Suggest potential links from note mentions

types.local_graph: Connections for current note and neighbors

features.filters: Show/hide specific tags or note types

performance_optimization.virtualization: Only render visible nodes for large graphs
performance_optimization.web_workers: Offload graph calculations to background threads

interactivity.zoom_pan: Canvas-based or SVG with zoom controls
interactivity.node_selection: Click to view note preview or navigate
interactivity.hover_details: Show note title and metadata on hover

customization.node_size: Based on backlink count or note length
customization.filters: Toggle visibility of tags, folders, note types

graph_database_options: PostgreSQL with recursive CTEs for graph queries
In-memory adjacency list for fast traversal
SQLite with FTS for full-text search + graph structure

what_makes_it_compelling: No forced hierarchy - organic knowledge growth

Index bidirectional links for fast graph queries

implementation_recommendations.scenario: User wants AI assistance for task management
implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Multi-model LLM routing with function calling
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Route different tasks (categorization, date extraction, summarization) to optimal models. Use function calling to execute actions (create task, set due date, add tags) directly.

technical_approach.models: GPT-4 for complex reasoning, Claude for text processing, local model for privacy-sensitive
technical_approach.function_calling: Define task creation, editing, categorization functions
technical_approach.routing_logic: If task requires reasoning → GPT-4, if summarization → Claude, if simple extraction → local model
technical_approach.execution: LLM calls functions to create/modify tasks autonomously

implementation_recommendations.estimated_roi: Very High - shifts from 'AI suggests' to 'AI executes'

implementation_recommendations.scenario: User wants to build consistent habits and engage daily
implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Gamification with streaks, karma points, and levels
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Apps with streaks + milestones see 40-60% higher DAU. Users 2.3x more likely to engage after 7+ day streak.

calculation.streak: If today - last_completed_date <= 1 day, increment; else reset
calculation.karma: Variable points: simple task = 5, priority task = 15, recurring = 10

ui_elements.streak_indicator: Prominent daily streak count with flame icon
ui_elements.level_badge: Show current level with progress bar to next
ui_elements.karma_toast: Show +X karma animation on task completion

implementation_recommendations.scenario: User wants to connect related notes and discover insights
implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Bidirectional linking with interactive knowledge graph
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Mirrors natural associative thinking, enables serendipitous discovery. Graph view reveals knowledge clusters and structural gaps.

database_schema.notes: id, title, content (Markdown with [[links]]), created_at, updated_at

link_parsing.autocomplete: Query notes table for titles matching partial input
link_parsing.creation: If target doesn't exist, create new note on link

backlink_display.real_time: Update backlinks panel on any note edit

graph_visualization.nodes: Each note is a node, size = backlink count
graph_visualization.interactivity: Click node to navigate, drag to rearrange, zoom/pan

performance.graph_query: Use recursive CTE or graph database (Neo4j)
performance.caching: Cache graph structure, invalidate on note changes
performance.lazy_load: Only render visible graph portion for large vaults

implementation_recommendations.estimated_roi: Medium-High - differentiating feature for knowledge workers

ui_indicators.conflict_ui: If conflict detected, show diff and allow manual resolution

service_worker.background_sync: Use Background Sync API for automatic sync when online
service_worker.cache: Cache static assets, API responses for offline use
